com.github.dylon.liblevenshtein.levenshtein

Interface IState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    State

    public interface IState
    Defines the methods on Levenshtein states, which consist of all possible position vectors at the current index of the spelling candidate.
    Since:
    2.1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(int[] position)
      Adds a new position to the linked-list of positions in this state.
      void clear()
      Unlinks and recycles all the positions in this state, making it empty.
      int[] getInner(int index)
      One of two cursors maintained in this state, which returns the position at the requested index.
      int[] getOuter(int index)
      One of two cursors maintained in this state, which returns the position at the requested index.
      void insert(int index, int[] position)
      Inserts a position into a specific location of the linked-list of positions.
      int[] removeInner()
      Unlinks the position corresponding to the inner cursor, at the last index requested of getInner(int).
      int size()
      Number of positions in this state.
      void sort(Comparator<int[]> comparator)
      Merge-sorts the positions in this state in a fashion that makes un-subsumption easy.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        int size()
        Number of positions in this state.
        Returns:
        Number of positions in this state.

      • add

        void add(int[] position)
        Adds a new position to the linked-list of positions in this state.
        Parameters:
        position - Position to add to those already in this state.

      • insert

        void insert(int index,
            int[] position)
        Inserts a position into a specific location of the linked-list of positions.
        Parameters:
        index - Location at which to insert the position.
        position - Position vector to insert into this state.

      • getOuter

        int[] getOuter(int index)
        One of two cursors maintained in this state, which returns the position at the requested index. Subsequent requests for positions at the immediately proceeding or preceding indices will begin at the index of the last position requested, so lookup for consecutive positions is fast.

        getOuter(int) is used within the outer loops of UnsubsumeFunctions.

        Parameters:
        index - Location of the position to return
        Returns:
        Position vector at the requested index.
        See Also:
        getInner(int)

      • getInner

        int[] getInner(int index)
        One of two cursors maintained in this state, which returns the position at the requested index. Subsequent requests for positions at the immediately proceeding or preceding indices will begin at the index of the last position requested, so lookup for consecutive positions is fast.

        getInner(int) is used within the inner loops of UnsubsumeFunctions.

        Parameters:
        index - Location of the position to return
        Returns:
        Position vector at the requested index.
        See Also:
        getOuter(int)

      • removeInner

        int[] removeInner()
        Unlinks the position corresponding to the inner cursor, at the last index requested of getInner(int).
        Returns:
        Position vector that was unlinked from those in this state.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Unlinks and recycles all the positions in this state, making it empty. This is usually done just before this state is itself recycled.

      • sort

        void sort(Comparator<int[]> comparator)
        Merge-sorts the positions in this state in a fashion that makes un-subsumption easy.
        Parameters:
        comparator - Describes how to sort the positions (dependent on the Levenshtein algorithm).
